snippet: With the states acting as laboratories for legislation that cannot advance in Washington, Republican policy changes are likely on a variety of issues.
abstract: Republicans post sweeping gains in state houses across America, taking control of legislatures in 29 states and 31 governorships; gains are particularly significant given that most major policy in country is coming out of states rather than Washington.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and MONICA DAVEY
byline.contributor: Mitch Smith contributed reporting from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: With the states acting as laboratories for legislation that cannot advance in Washington, Republican policy changes are likely on a variety of issues.

headline.main: With Statehouse Victories, Republicans Are Poised to Enact Changes
headline.print_headline: With Statehouse Victories, Republicans Are Poised to Enact Changes
